header.name: Tyler Chenoweth
header.title: Software Engineer
header.summary: Experienced Software Developer with over 6+ years of expertise in building scalable, high- performance web applications. Proficient in Python, Django, and JavaScript, with recent work integrating AI/LLM tools, data visualization, and interactive frontends. Adept at problem-solving, collaborating across teams, and delivering clean, user-focused solutions. Seeking to contribute to a forward-thinking development team with a strong engineering culture.

job_bullets: Developed interactive frontend applications using React, Next.js, Streamlit, and Flask with Django backends, powering AI and NLP tools for real-time visualization of LLM outputs, sentiment analysis, and linguistic patterns through token-level charts, semantic summaries, and dynamic graphs.

Engineered high-performance, map-based interfaces with Leaflet.js and OpenStreetMap to render and cluster hundreds of thousands of geocoded locations, optimizing client-side rendering with batched data and local JSON storage.

Collaborated across interdisciplinary teams in a fast-paced environment to prototype and deliver Dockerized, user-focused AI analysis tools, integrating models like LLaMA, Mistral, and DeepSeek with clean, responsive UIs for cultural and bias comparison.
Built a full-stack web application using Django REST Framework, PostgreSQL, and Next.js, with asynchronous task handling via Celery and real-time interaction between the frontend and backend APIs.
Developed scalable, data-driven features with AWS-integrated PostgreSQL, leveraging pgAdmin for database administration and GitLab for version control and CI/CD adherence.

Collaborated across interdisciplinary teams in a fast-paced environment to prototype and deliver Dockerized, user-focused AI analysis tools, integrating models like LLaMA, Mistral, and DeepSeek with clean, responsive UIs for cultural and bias comparison.

Delivered frontend and backend features for a Dockerized Django + PostgreSQL web application, including direct implementation of user-facing components and test-driven development with PyTest to ensure system stability.

Collaborated closely with the client on-site for six months, gathering real-time feedback and translating evolving requirements into actionable development updates, ensuring the product aligned with user needs.
Contributed to project success using a modern development stack (Django, PostgreSQL, GraphQL, Docker), and authored comprehensive end-user documentation to support adoption and usability.
Led UI redesign efforts in collaboration with clients to improve usability and visual consistency across multiple sites, while managing full-stack development using Flask, MongoDB, and Elasticsearch.
Built custom Python 3 tools to streamline backend testing workflows and contributed to automated testing by writing and maintaining test cases.
Participated in regular client scrum meetings to track progress and deliver updates, and helped maintain and expand a secure cyber-guard system for cross-network file exchange.
Enhanced a cross-domain solution for secure file exchange, contributing to a large-scale software system in a Linux-based Agile environment using GitLab, Jenkins, JIRA, and VMware.
Deployed and configured the Large Dataset Analysis Tool (LDAT) on CentOS 7 to evaluate AGIS performance, creating test files to identify and resolve filtering issues across varied data types.
Extracted and analyzed web portal data using SQL, creating dynamic Excel dashboards with Power Query, pivot tables, and charts to automate reporting and improve data visualization.
Streamlined analysis workflows to enhance efficiency and ensure accurate, actionable insights for stakeholders.
